description: Array T(n,k), n,k nonnegative: the total number of checks required by a "double-support" algorithm to find out which rows and columns of each of the n by k zero-one matrices are nonzero.
comments: I.e. T(n,k) = sum_{m in M(n,k)} checks(m), where M(n,k) contains all n by k matrices and checks(M) is the number of checks to find all nonzero rows and columns of m.Conjecture: T(n,k) = T(k,n).max(n,k) (2-2^(-min(n,k))) <= T(n,k)/2^(n*k) if n > 0 and k > 0.T(n,k)/2^(n*k) <= 2max(n,k)+2 -( min(n,k)+2max(n,k))2^(-min(n,k)) -(2min(n,k)+3max(n,k))2^(-max(n,k)). The lower bound is a lower bound for any algorithm to carry out the same task.
references: M.R.C. van Dongen, Technical Report: TR0004, CS Dept, UCC, College Road, Cork, Ireland
author: M.R.C. van Dongen (dongen(AT)cs.ucc.ie), Dec 15 2000
